title: CAFOs are efficient and keep food prices low

content.question: Which of the following accurately describes a benefit of concentrated animal feeding operations <math alttext="C A F O s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>CAFO</mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Concentrated animal feeding operations produce a large amount of manure, which is then often held in large manure lagoons.
The animals raised in concentrated animal feeding operations are usually grass-fed and therefore less susceptible to disease.
Concentrated animal feeding operations are efficient and relatively low-cost facilities that help keep consumer costs low.
When animals are kept in large concentrations in a small area, the water quality of local waterways is protected from excess runoff.

content.answer: Concentrated animal feeding operations are efficient and relatively low-cost facilities that help keep consumer costs low.
